ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
Then the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said at that: 'Fear Allah (Taqwa) and reconcile matters between yourselves, for indeed Allah reconciles between the believers.'[170] And this is an alert that that is only attained by adorning oneself with the character traits (Akhlaq) of Allah, and it is reconciliation of matters between (people) and the rest of the character traits. So reflect now in your soul (Nafs) if your record is free from injustices, or if you are treated with gentleness until you are forgiven and you become certain of eternal happiness (Sa'ada), how will your joy be upon your departure from the assembly of the open space, and the garment of contentment (Rida) has been bestowed upon you, and you return with a happiness after which there is no misery, and with a bliss (Na'eem) whose edges are not encircled by annihilation. And at that, your heart (Qalb) flew with joy and happiness, and your face whitened and illuminated and shone as the moon shines on the night of the full moon. So imagine yourself strutting among the creation, raising your head, your back free from burdens, and the freshness of the breeze of bliss and the coolness of contentment (Rida) gleams from your forehead, and the creation of the first and the last look at you and at your state and envy you for your goodness and beauty, and the angels walk before you and behind you and proclaim upon the heads of the assemblies: 'This is so-and-so son of so-and-so, may Allah be pleased with him and make him pleased, and he has attained a happiness after which he will never be miserable forever.' Do you think that this station is not greater than the position you attain in the hearts of the creation in the world through your ostentation (Riya'), your flattery, your affectation, and your adornment? If you know that it is better than it, indeed there is no comparison of it to it, then seek to reach this rank through pure sincerity (Ikhlas) and truthful intention (Niyya) in your dealings with Allah, for you will not attain that except through it.

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Disciplining the Soul
Know that every human is ignorant of the defects of his own self (Nafs), so if he strives against his self (Nafs) with the slightest striving (Mujahadah) until he abandons the gross sins, perhaps he imagines of his self (Nafs) that he has refined his self (Nafs) and beautified his character (Khuluq) and become independent of striving (Mujahadah). Therefore, it is necessary to clarify the sign of good character (Khuluq). For good character (Khuluq) is faith (Iman), and bad character (Khuluq) is hypocrisy (Nifaq). And Allah the Exalted has mentioned the attributes of the believers (Mu'minun) and the hypocrites (Munafiqun) in His Book, and they are in their entirety the fruit of good character (Khuluq) and bad character (Khuluq). So let us present a collection of that so you may learn the sign of good character (Khuluq). Allah the Exalted said: 'Successful indeed are the believers (Mu'minun) who are humble in their prayers and who turn away from idle talk' to His saying 'Those are the inheritors.' And He the Mighty and Majestic said: 'The repentant, the worshippers, the praisers' to His saying 'and give glad tidings to the believers (Mu'minun).' And He the Mighty and Majestic said: 'Indeed, the believers (Mu'minun) are those who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts (Qulub) tremble, and when His verses are recited to them, it increases them in faith (Iman) and upon their Lord they rely' to His saying 'Those are the believers (Mu'minun) in truth.' And He the Exalted said: 'And the servants of the Most Merciful who walk upon the earth easily and when the ignorant address them, they say peace' to the end of the Surah. Whoever is confused about his state, let him present his self (Nafs) to these verses, for the presence of all these attributes is a sign of good character (Khuluq), and the absence of all of them is a sign of bad character (Khuluq), and the presence of some of them without others indicates some without others, so let him occupy himself with acquiring what he lacks and preserving what he has found.

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Etiquette of Quran Recitation
Allah the Exalted said: 'Those who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts (Qulub) tremble with awe, and when His verses are recited to them, it increases them in faith (Iman), and upon their Lord they rely (Yatawakkalun).' And the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The best of people in voice with the Quran is the one whom, when you hear him recite, you see that he fears Allah the Exalted.' And he (peace be upon him) said: 'No one hears the Quran from anyone more desirable than one who fears Allah the Mighty and Majestic.' So the Quran is intended to attract these states (Ahwal) to the heart (Qalb) and to act upon it; otherwise, the effort in moving the tongue with its letters is light.

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Foundations of Belief
The third aspect: its basis is doubt and its meaning is 'I am a true believer (Mu'min Haqqan) if Allah wills,' since Allah the Exalted said to a specific group of individuals: 'Those are the true believers (Mu'minun Haqqan)' (Quran 8:4). They divided into two categories, and this refers to doubt about the perfection of faith (Iman) not its foundation. Every person doubts the perfection of their faith (Iman), and that is not disbelief (Kufr). Doubt about the perfection of faith (Iman) is valid from two perspectives: First, because hypocrisy (Nifaq) removes the perfection of faith (Iman), and it is hidden such that one cannot ascertain freedom from it. Second, it is perfected through acts of obedience (Ta'at), and one does not know if they exist in perfection. As for action, Allah the Exalted said: 'Indeed, the believers (Mu'minun) are those who have believed in Allah and His Messenger and then doubt not but strive with their properties and their selves in the cause of Allah. It is those who are the truthful (Sadiqun)' (Quran 49:15). Thus, doubt arises about this truthfulness (Sidq). Similarly, Allah the Exalted said: 'But righteousness (Al-Birr) is [in] one who believes in Allah, the Last Day, the angels, the Book, and the prophets' (Quran 2:177). He stipulated twenty descriptions such as fulfilling the covenant and patience in hardships, then said: 'Those are the ones who have been truthful (Sadaqu)' (Quran 2:177). And He said: 'Allah will raise those who have believed among you and those who were given knowledge by degrees' (Quran 58:11). And He said: 'Not equal among you are those who spent before the conquest and fought' (Quran 57:10) the verse. And He said: 'They are degrees with Allah' (Quran 8:4). [Remember, O believers], when Allah promised you one of the two groups - that it would be yours - and you wished that the unarmed one would be yours. But Allah intended to establish the truth by His words and to eliminate the disbelievers
That He should establish the truth and abolish falsehood, even if the criminals disliked it.
[Remember] when you asked help of your Lord, and He answered you, "Indeed, I will reinforce you with a thousand from the angels, following one another."
And Allah made it not but good tidings and so that your hearts would be assured thereby. And victory is not but from Allah. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.

[Remember] when He overwhelmed you with drowsiness [giving] security from Him and sent down upon you from the sky, rain by which to purify you and remove from you the evil [suggestions] of Satan and to make steadfast your hearts and plant firmly thereby your feet.

[Remember] when your Lord inspired to the angels, "I am with you, so strengthen those who have believed. I will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieved, so strike [them] upon the necks and strike from them every fingertip."
That is because they opposed Allah and His Messenger. And whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger - indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
"That [is yours], so taste it." And indeed for the disbelievers is the punishment of the Fire.
O you who have believed, when you meet those who disbelieve advancing [for battle], do not turn to them your backs [in flight].

And whoever turns his back to them on such a day, unless swerving [as a strategy] for war or joining [another] company, has certainly returned with anger [upon him] from Allah, and his refuge is Hell - and wretched is the destination.

And you did not kill them, but it was Allah who killed them. And you threw not, [O Muhammad], when you threw, but it was Allah who threw that He might test the believers with a good test. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

And when hearing is obtained regarding such matters, the apparent interpretation (Tafsir) is known, which is the translation of the words, and that is not sufficient for understanding the realities of the meanings. And the difference between the realities of the meanings and the apparent interpretation is understood with an example, which is that Allah the Exalted said: 'And you did not throw when you threw, but Allah threw.' So its apparent meaning is a clear interpretation, but the reality of its meaning is obscure, for it is an affirmation of throwing and a denial of it, and they are contradictory in appearance unless it is understood that he threw from one aspect and did not throw from another aspect, and from the aspect from which he did not throw, Allah the Exalted threw him. And similarly, Allah the Exalted said: 'Fight them; Allah will punish them by your hands.' So if they are the fighters, how can Allah the Glorified be the punisher? And if Allah the Exalted is the punisher by moving their hands, then what is the meaning of commanding them to fight? The reality of this draws from a vast ocean of the sciences of unveilings (Mukashafat), which the apparent interpretation cannot suffice for. It is to know the aspect of connection of actions with the originated power (Qudrah Hadithah) and to understand the aspect of connection of the power with the power of Allah the Exalted, until after clarifying many obscure matters, the truth of His saying the Exalted is unveiled: 'And you did not throw when you threw, but Allah threw.' And perhaps if a lifetime were spent in exploring the secrets of this meaning and what is connected to its premises and consequences, the lifetime would end before completing all its consequences.

When hearing occurs with such matters, the apparent interpretation (Tafsir) is known, which is the translation of words, and that is not sufficient for understanding the realities of meanings (Haqa'iq al-Ma'ani). The difference between the realities of meanings and the apparent interpretation is understood through an example, which is that Allah, the Exalted, said: 'And you did not throw when you threw, but Allah threw.' Its apparent meaning is a clear interpretation, but the reality of its meaning is obscure, for it affirms throwing and negates it, and these are contradictory in appearance unless it is understood that he threw from one aspect and did not throw from another aspect, and from the aspect from which he did not throw, Allah, the Exalted, threw. Similarly, Allah, the Exalted, said: 'Fight them; Allah will punish them by your hands.' If they are the fighters, how can Allah, the Glorified, be the punisher? And if Allah, the Exalted, is the punisher by moving their hands, what is the meaning of commanding them to fight? The reality of this is drawn from a vast ocean of the sciences of unveilings (Mukashafat), which the apparent interpretation cannot replace. It is to know the aspect of the connection of actions to the created power (Qudrah Hadithah) and to understand the aspect of the connection of power to the power of Allah, the Exalted, until after clarifying many obscure matters, the truth of His saying, the Exalted, is revealed: 'And you did not throw when you threw, but Allah threw.' Perhaps if a lifetime were spent in exploring the secrets of this meaning and what is connected to its premises and consequences, the lifetime would end before completing all its consequences. There is not a single word of the Quran whose verification does not require something like that. Its secrets are only revealed to those firmly grounded in knowledge (Rasikhun fi al-'Ilm) according to the abundance of their knowledge, the purity of their hearts (Qulub), the abundance of their motives for reflection, and their devotion to seeking. Each one has a limit in ascending to a degree higher than it. As for completion, there is no hope for it, even if the sea were ink and the trees pens, for the secrets of Allah's words have no end; the seas would be exhausted before the words of Allah, the Exalted, are exhausted. a.g: That [is so], and [also] that Allah will weaken the plot of the disbelievers.

If you [disbelievers] seek the victory - the defeat has come to you. And if you desist [from hostilities], it is best for you; but if you return [to war], We will return, and never will you be availed by your [large] company at all, even if it should increase; and [that is] because Allah is with the believers.
O you who have believed, obey Allah and His Messenger and do not turn from him while you hear [his order].
And do not be like those who say, "We have heard," while they do not hear.
Indeed, the worst of living creatures in the sight of Allah are the deaf and dumb who do not use reason.
Had Allah known any good in them, He would have made them hear. And if He had made them hear, they would [still] have turned away, while they were refusing.

O you who have believed, respond to Allah and to the Messenger when he calls you to that which gives you life. And know that Allah intervenes between a man and his heart and that to Him you will be gathered.

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Wonders of the Heart
And whoever is ignorant of his Heart (Qalb) is more ignorant of other things, since most of creation are ignorant of their hearts and their selves (Anfus), and a barrier has been placed between them and their selves. For indeed Allah places a barrier between the person and his heart, and His placing of a barrier is by preventing him from witnessing it, observing it, and knowing its attributes and how it fluctuates between two fingers among the fingers of the Most Merciful, and how it sometimes descends to the lowest of the low and sinks to the horizon of the devils, and how at other times it rises to the highest heights and ascends to the world of the angels brought near. And whoever does not know his heart to observe it, care for it, and watch for what appears from the treasures of the dominion upon it and within it, he is among those about whom Allah the Exalted said: 'They forgot Allah, so He made them forget themselves. Those are the defiantly disobedient.' So knowledge of the Heart and the reality of its attributes is the foundation of the religion and the basis of the path of the travelers.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Love, Longing, and Intimacy
This indicates that whoever is afflicted with a town where sins are abundant and good is scarce has no excuse for residing there; rather, he should emigrate. Allah the Exalted said: 'Was not the earth of Allah spacious enough for you to emigrate therein?' If he is prevented from that by dependents or ties, he should not be content with his state, at peace in his soul (Nafs) with it; rather, he should be disturbed in his heart (Qalb) from it, saying constantly: 'Our Lord, take us out of this town whose people are wrongdoers.' This is because when injustice becomes widespread, calamity descends and destroys everyone, encompassing the obedient. Allah the Exalted said: 'And fear a trial (Fitnah) that will not afflict those who have wronged among you exclusively.' Therefore, there is absolutely no absolute contentment in any of the causes of deficiency in religion except from the perspective of attributing them to the action of Allah the Exalted; as for them in themselves, there is no aspect for contentment with them in any state.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Patience and Gratitude
And when the doors of the world were opened upon the Companions (may Allah be pleased with them), they said: 'We were tested with the trial (fitnah) of hardship, so we were patient, and we were tested with the trial (fitnah) of ease, so we were not patient.' Therefore, Allah warned His servants from the trial (fitnah) of wealth, spouse, and children, so He, the Exalted, said: 'O you who have believed, let not your wealth and your children divert you from the remembrance (dhikr) of Allah' (Quran 63:9). And He, the Mighty and Majestic, said: 'Indeed, among your spouses and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them' (Quran 64:14). And he (the Prophet, peace be upon him) said: 'The child is a miser-maker, a coward-maker, a sorrow-maker.' And when he (the Prophet, peace be upon him) looked at his son Al-Hasan (may Allah be pleased with him) stumbling in his shirt, he descended from the pulpit and embraced him, then said: 'Allah has spoken the truth: "And know that your wealth and your children are a trial (fitnah)" (Quran 8:28). Indeed, when I saw my son stumbling, I could not control my soul (nafs) from taking him.' In that is a lesson for those of insight.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Patience and Gratitude
If you say: You have included wealth, status, lineage, family, and children within the realm of blessings, yet Allah the Exalted has censured wealth and status, and likewise the Messenger (peace be upon him) and the scholars. Allah said: 'Indeed, among your spouses and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them' (64:14). And the Almighty said: 'And know that your wealth and your children are a trial (Fitnah)' (8:28). And Ali (may Allah honor his face) said in censuring lineage: 'People are children of what they excel at, and the value of every person is what he excels at,' and it is said: 'A person is by himself, not by his father.' So what is the meaning of them being a blessing while being censured religiously? Know that whoever takes knowledge from transmitted words that are interpreted and generalities that are specified, misguidance is more prevalent upon him unless he is guided by the light (Nur) of Allah the Exalted to comprehend the sciences as they truly are, then he applies the transmission in accordance with what has become clear to him from them through interpretation at times and specification at others. These are blessings that assist in the matter of the Hereafter, with no way to deny them except that they contain trials (Fitnah) and fears. The example of wealth is like a snake that contains beneficial antidote (Tiryaq) and beneficial poison. If it is obtained by the charmer who knows the method of precaution from its poison and the way to extract its beneficial antidote, it is a blessing. But if it is obtained by the ignorant black person, it is upon him calamity and destruction. And it is like the sea beneath which are varieties of jewels and pearls. Whoever attains the sea, if he is knowledgeable in swimming, the way of diving, and the way of precaution from the perils of the sea, he has attained its blessings. But if he enters it ignorant of that, he has perished. Therefore, Allah the Exalted praised wealth and called it good, and the Messenger (peace be upon him) praised it and said: 'What an excellent aid to the fear (Taqwa) of Allah the Exalted is wealth.' And likewise, He praised status and honor since Allah the Exalted bestowed upon His Messenger (peace be upon him) by manifesting him...

a.g: And [remember, O Muhammad], when those who disbelieved plotted against you to restrain you or kill you or evict you [from Makkah]. But they plan, and Allah plans. And Allah is the best of planners.
And when Our verses are recited to them, they say, "We have heard. If we willed, we could say [something] like this. This is not but legends of the former peoples."
And [remember] when they said, "O Allah, if this should be the truth from You, then rain down upon us stones from the sky or bring us a painful punishment."
But Allah would not punish them while you, [O Muhammad], are among them, and Allah would not punish them while they seek forgiveness.

But why should Allah not punish them while they obstruct [people] from al-Masjid al- Haram and they were not [fit to be] its guardians? Its [true] guardians are not but the righteous, but most of them do not know.
And their prayer at the House was not except whistling and handclapping. So taste the punishment for what you disbelieved.

Indeed, those who disbelieve spend their wealth to avert [people] from the way of Allah. So they will spend it; then it will be for them a [source of] regret; then they will be overcome. And those who have disbelieved - unto Hell they will be gathered.
[This is] so that Allah may distinguish the wicked from the good and place the wicked some of them upon others and heap them all together and put them into Hell. It is those who are the losers.

Say to those who have disbelieved [that] if they cease, what has previously occurred will be forgiven for them. But if they return [to hostility] - then the precedent of the former [rebellious] peoples has already taken place.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Patience and Gratitude
And it is not conceivable that this would be rare and anomalous, and with the rarity it varies in scarcity and abundance, and its abundance is only in the eras close to the eras of the Prophets, peace be upon them. The interval continues to increase in length, and such hearts increase in scarcity until the Hour approaches and Allah decrees a matter that was to be done. And it was necessary for this to be rare because it is the beginnings of the kingdom of the Hereafter, and the kingdom is mighty, and kings do not abound. Just as the one who excels in kingdom and beauty is only rare, and most people are beneath them, so it is in the kingdom of the Hereafter. For the world is a mirror of the Hereafter, for it is an expression of the world of witnessing, and the Hereafter is an expression of the world of the unseen, and the world of witnessing follows the world of the unseen, just as the image in the mirror follows the image of the viewer in the mirror. And the image in the mirror, even though it is second in the rank of existence, it is foremost in the right of your vision, for you do not see yourself and you see your image in the mirror first, so you know by it your image that is established by you second, by way of imitation. So the heart that follows in existence is followed in the right of knowledge, and the heart that is delayed is advanced, and this is a type of inversion. But inversion and reversal are necessities of this world. Likewise, the world of dominion and witnessing imitates the world of the unseen and the sovereignty. So among people are those for whom the view of consideration is made easy, so he does not look at anything from the world of dominion except that he crosses with it to the world of sovereignty, so his crossing is called a lesson, and the Truth has commanded it, saying: 'So take lesson, O possessors of insight' (Quran 59:2). And among them are those whose insight is blinded, so he does not take lesson, so he is confined in the world of dominion and witnessing, and the doors of Hell will open to his confinement, and this confinement is filled with fire.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Patience and Gratitude
And it is not conceivable that this be rare and exceptional, and with the rarity it varies in scarcity and abundance, and its abundance is only in the eras close to the eras of the Prophets, peace be upon them. The interval continues to increase in length, and such Hearts (Qalb) increase in scarcity until the Hour approaches and Allah decrees a matter that was to be done. And it is necessary that this be rare because it is the beginning of the kingdom of the Hereafter, and the kingdom is mighty, and kings do not abound. Just as the excellent in kingdom and beauty is only rare, and most people are beneath them, so too in the kingdom of the Hereafter. For the Worldly Life (Dunya) is a mirror of the Hereafter (Akhirah), for it is an expression of the world of Witnessing (Shahadah), and the Hereafter is an expression of the world of the Unseen (Ghayb), and the world of Witnessing follows the world of the Unseen, just as the image in the mirror follows the image of the viewer in the mirror. And the image in the mirror, even though it is second in rank of existence, is first in terms of your seeing, for you do not see yourself and you see your image in the mirror first, then you know by it your image that is established by you second, by way of imitation. So the Heart (Qalb) that is following in existence is followed in terms of knowledge, and the Heart that is delayed is advanced, and this is a type of reversal. But reversal and inversion are necessities of this world. Likewise, the world of Dominion (Mulk) and Witnessing (Shahadah) imitates the world of the Unseen (Ghayb) and the Dominion (Malakut). Among people are those for whom the gaze of consideration is made easy, so he does not look at anything from the world of Dominion except that he crosses with it to the world of Dominion, and his crossing is called a lesson. And the Truth has commanded it, saying: 'So take lesson, O you of insight' (Quran 59:2). And among them are those whose insight is blinded, so he does not take lesson, and he is confined in the world of Dominion and Witnessing, and the doors of Hell will open to his confinement, and this confinement is filled with fire.

And Sa'd ibn Bilal said: On the Day of Resurrection, two men are ordered to be taken out from the Fire, and Allah, Blessed and Exalted, says: 'That is for what your hands have sent forth, and Allah is not unjust to the servants (8:51).' a.g: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and of those before them. They disbelieved in the signs of Allah, so Allah seized them for their sins. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and severe in penalty.
That is because Allah would not change a favor which He had bestowed upon a people until they change what is within themselves. And indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

[Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and of those before them. They denied the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh. And all [of them] were wrongdoers.
Indeed, the worst of living creatures in the sight of Allah are those who have disbelieved, and they will not [ever] believe -
The ones with whom you made a treaty but then they break their pledge every time, and they do not fear Allah.
So if you, [O Muhammad], gain dominance over them in war, disperse by [means of] them those behind them that perhaps they will be reminded.
If you [have reason to] fear from a people betrayal, throw [their treaty] back to them, [putting you] on equal terms. Indeed, Allah does not like traitors.
And let not those who disbelieve think they will escape. Indeed, they will not cause failure [to Allah].

And prepare against them whatever you are able of power and of steeds of war by which you may terrify the enemy of Allah and your enemy and others besides them whom you do not know [but] whom Allah knows. And whatever you spend in the cause of Allah will be fully repaid to you, and you will not be wronged.

If it is incumbent upon you by the command of Allah to be cautious of the disbelieving enemy whom you see, then it is more incumbent upon you to be cautious of an enemy who sees you while you do not see him. Therefore, Ibn Muhayriz said: 'A prey that you see but does not see you, you are likely to capture it; and a prey that sees you but you do not see it, it is likely to capture you.' He was referring to Satan (Shaytan). How can it be otherwise when neglecting the enmity of the disbeliever results only in killing, which is martyrdom (Shahadah), while neglecting caution from Satan exposes one to the Fire (Nar) and painful punishment? It is not part of being occupied with Allah to turn away from what Allah has warned against, and this invalidates the doctrine of the second group in their assumption that this detracts from Reliance (Tawakkul). For taking up the shield and weapon, gathering troops, and digging the trench did not detract from the Reliance (Tawakkul) of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), so how can caution from what Allah has warned against and being cautious from what He has commanded to be cautious from detract from Reliance (Tawakkul)? We have mentioned in the Book of Reliance (Kitab al-Tawakkul) what clarifies the error of those who claim that the meaning of Reliance (Tawakkul) is complete abandonment of means, and His saying, the Exalted, 'And prepare against them whatever you are able of power and of steeds of war by which you may terrify the enemy of Allah and your enemy and others besides them whom you do not know [but] whom Allah knows. And whatever you spend in the cause of Allah will be fully repaid to you, and you will not be wronged' does not contradict compliance with Reliance (Tawakkul), as long as the Heart (Qalb) believes that the One who harms and benefits, gives life and causes death is Allah, the Exalted. Similarly, one should be cautious of Satan (Shaytan) and believe that the Guide (Al-Hadi) and the Misleader (Al-Mudill) is Allah, and see the means as subservient intermediaries - as we have mentioned in Reliance (Tawakkul).

And He (Allah), the Exalted, said: "Indeed, he sees you, he and his tribe, from where you do not see them." And the Quran from its beginning to its end is a warning from Satan, so how is it that He commanded caution from the enemy as He commanded caution from the disbelievers? He said, the Exalted: "And let them take their precaution and their weapons," and He said, the Exalted: "And prepare for them what you are able of strength and of tethering the horses, you frighten with it the enemy of Allah and your enemy and others besides them whom you do not know them, Allah knows them. And whatever you spend of anything in the path of Allah, it will be repaid to you, and you will not be wronged." So if it is incumbent upon you by the command of Allah to be cautious from the disbelieving enemy while you see him, then that it is incumbent upon you to be cautious from an enemy who sees you and you do not see him is more deserving. And for that reason, Ibn Muhayriz said: "A prey you see and it does not see you, you are likely to capture it, and a prey that sees you and you do not see it, it is likely to capture you." He pointed to Satan, so how is it that there is not in heedlessness of the enmity of the disbeliever except killing which is martyrdom, and in neglecting caution from Satan is exposure to the Fire and the painful punishment? So it is not from preoccupation with Allah to turn away from what Allah warned, and by this, the doctrine of the second group is invalidated in their assumption that this detracts from Reliance (Tawakkul). For taking the shield and weapons, gathering the soldiers, and digging the trench did not detract from the Reliance (Tawakkul) of the Messenger of Allah ï·º, so how can caution from what Allah warned about and caution from what He commanded to be cautious from detract from Reliance (Tawakkul)? And we have mentioned in the book of Reliance (Tawakkul) what clarifies the error of those who claim that the meaning of Reliance (Tawakkul) is complete abandonment of means, and His saying, the Exalted: "And prepare for them what you are able of strength and of tethering the horses" does not contradict compliance with Reliance (Tawakkul), as long as the Heart (Qalb) believes that the Harmful and the Beneficial, the Giver of Life (Muhyi) and the Causer of Death (Mumit) is Allah, the Exalted. Likewise, one is cautious of Satan and believes that the Guide (Hadi) and the Misleader (Mudill) is Allah, and sees the means as subjugated intermediaries - as we mentioned in Reliance (Tawakkul).

Know that these craftsmen who rectify foods and other things, if their opinions had diverged and their natures had clashed like the natures of wild beasts, they would have scattered and distanced themselves, and none would have benefited from another. Rather, they would have been like wild beasts that no single place contains and no single purpose unites. a.g: O Prophet, sufficient for you is Allah and for whoever follows you of the believers.

O Prophet, urge the believers to battle. If there are among you twenty [who are] steadfast, they will overcome two hundred. And if there are among you one hundred [who are] steadfast, they will overcome a thousand of those who have disbelieved because they are a people who do not understand.

Now, Allah has lightened [the hardship] for you, and He knows that among you is weakness. So if there are from you one hundred [who are] steadfast, they will overcome two hundred. And if there are among you a thousand, they will overcome two thousand by permission of Allah. And Allah is with the steadfast.

It is not for a prophet to have captives [of war] until he inflicts a massacre [upon Allah 's enemies] in the land. Some Muslims desire the commodities of this world, but Allah desires [for you] the Hereafter. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
If not for a decree from Allah that preceded, you would have been touched for what you took by a great punishment.
So consume what you have taken of war booty [as being] lawful and good, and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

O Prophet, say to whoever is in your hands of the captives, "If Allah knows [any] good in your hearts, He will give you [something] better than what was taken from you, and He will forgive you; and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."
But if they intend to betray you - then they have already betrayed Allah before, and He empowered [you] over them. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.

Indeed, those who have believed and emigrated and fought with their wealth and lives in the cause of Allah and those who gave shelter and aided - they are allies of one another. But those who believed and did not emigrate - for you there is no guardianship of them until they emigrate. And if they seek help of you for the religion, then you must help, except against a people between yourselves and whom is a treaty. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.
And those who disbelieved are allies of one another. If you do not do so, there will be fitnah on earth and great corruption.

Marriage, due to repelling the danger of desire (Shahwah), is important in the religion for everyone who is not afflicted with impotence or disability, and they are the majority of creation. And Allah the Exalted has mentioned the attributes of the believers and the hypocrites in His Book, and they are in their entirety the fruit of good character and bad character. So let us mention a collection of that to know the sign of good character. Allah the Exalted said: "Successful indeed are the believers who are humble in their prayers and who turn away from idle talk" to His saying "Those are the inheritors." And He the Mighty and Majestic said: "The repentant, the worshippers, the praisers" to His saying "and give glad tidings to the believers." And He the Mighty and Majestic said: "The believers are only those who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts tremble" to His saying "Those are the believers in truth." And He the Exalted said: "And the servants of the Most Merciful who walk upon the earth easily and when the ignorant address them, they say peace" to the end of the surah. Whoever is confused about his condition, let him present himself to these verses, for the presence of all these attributes is a sign of good character, and the absence of all of them is a sign of bad character, and the presence of some without others indicates some without others, so let him occupy himself with acquiring what he lacks and preserving what he has found.
